lines.text: Stop titivating yourself, come on.
Very well, you shall be master for a bit longer.
I really am a remarkable man. It's my memory. They shall have it for the Museum when I die.
You're a rum 'un. I thought we was never going to do nothing.
It's very aggravating when your love isn't true...
The boy I love is up in the gallery, / The boy I love is looking down at me...
Do you mind if I take my coat off? I always work better with my coat off. Saucy shirt, isn't it?
The rubies, Bella, give me the rubies.
You will die, raving, in an asylum.
Was I a part of this curious dream?
Why did you ever marry me?
When I married you, you were normal, at least I thought you were.
You want me.
And do you want me?
I've always wanted you.
Who are you?
Just a figment of your wife's imagination.
How did you get in here?
Interesting things about us ghosts, we don't have to bother with doors.
The knife, Bella, get the knife!

[holding the knife]
Knife? What knife? Do you see a knife in my hand? Have you gone mad my sane husband?
Thank Heavens you're not his wife.
Not his wife?
No, he was married to another woman long before you, and she's still alive.
You break into my house and go through my desk!
Which both you and I know contains the evidence that you are Louis Barlow.
The only one that can help us is that woman.
Well she's mad.
She will be if she stays in that house.
Do you think she knows her husband isn't Mallen?
She knows something, that's why she's dangerous to him, that's why we've got to get her out of there.

[Paul refuses to talk to her during the cab ride home]
Hit me, hurt me, do anything but for Pete's sake, speak to me.
The rubies. For one woman you killed her to get them, and for me you tried to kill my mind, tried to drive me insane.
I trust the stool is right.
Thank you.
